titles.title: To amend the National Security Act of 1947 to establish the positions of Director, Deputy Director, and Senior Directors of the National Security Council and to require that their appointments be subject to confirmation by the Senate, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the Committee on National Security, and in addition to the Committees on International Relations, and Intelligence (Permanent Select), for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

term.name: Advice and consent of the Senate

bill.summary: 4/7/1995--Introduced. Amends the National Security Act of 1947 to require the National Security Council to have a director, deputy director, and such senior directors as determined necessary by the President. Requires presidential appointment and Senate confirmation of each such position.
